intro: Bryonia tenuis, commonly known as the slender bryony, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Benincaseae. It is native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa, typically growing in dry, rocky habitats. The plant produces yellow, funnel-shaped flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds. Bryonia tenuis is characterized by its trailing stems and small, lobed leaves.
